lines.text:
[to priest]
Excuse me, one second.
[takes Hans' jersey and lays it on the coffin, then addresses the 'Ducks']
Every time you touch the ice, remember that it was Hans who taught us to fly.

[picks hockey puck up off the ice and addresses the Ducks]
What's the one thing all great teams have in common?
Great coaching.

[unamused]
Don't try to suck up to me, Averman.
[pause]
Defense. See, unlike scoring, defense never quits. But to play great defense you need one thing above all else.

[sarcastically, to Goldberg]
Bet it starts with a W.

Confidence. Listen, if you learn nothin' else when you're here, you learn this, all right? This is not just about hockey. It's easy to be confident when you have control of the puck. It's very, very difficult to keep that confidence when you gotta take whatever strange bounces life throws your way. Don't be careless, but don't be too careful either. You cannot be afraid to lose! That's how you gain the confidence to attack the game when the puck isn't yours. That's how you attack life... even when you think you don't have any control. And that's how you play real defense.

[to the board]
You know why I'm so good? Because I had a good education, you gave it to me. And you're going to give it to these kids.

[to Charlie]
He *is* good.
Just getting started.

Charlie and the Ducks. And as hard as I fought it, there you were. You gave me a life, Charlie, and I want to say thank you. I told Orien about all this when I talked to him about taking over. I told him that you were the heart of the team and that you would learn something from each other. I told him that you were the real Minnesota Miracle Man.

[astonished]
You did?

[nods]
So be that man, Charlie. Be that man.
It's not enough that I get shot at on the ice, now I have to worry about getting nailed off the ice. Why am I always getting shot at?
You're a goalie, dude. Deal.
Every Monday you will have a practice quiz. Every Wednesday you will have a real quiz. Every Friday you will have an exam. And any time I FEEL like it you will have a surprise quiz or exam.
[In the goal singing]
Fulton scored, Fulton scored. I am really bored. Fulton's great, Fulton's great. A year ago he couldn't even skate.
Great, now I have to worry about being nailed off the ice as well. Why am I always getting shot at?
You're a goalie, dude, deal.
Thanks, Fulton, real sensitive.
You're welcome.
Goldberg, when's the last time you practiced?
Well, we don't really practice per say. We either play or... play around.

[to the ducks]
You're nothin' but white trash!

[leans forward]
Uh, who are you callin' white trash?

[Gordon has set Charlie's alarm for 6AM]
Go away.
Can't do that. Come on.
[flips Charlie and his mattress over]
Get dressed, Charlie.

[walking down the hall with Charlie, he leads him to a trophey cabinet and motions to a picture of himself]
Check this out. Look at that hair.
[chuckles]
I look like Greg Brady.
Hey, Biff. One more thing. After we beat you, the Warriors die and the Ducks fly.

[blows whistle]
Let's go! Get over here! Take a knee. You guys are not skating like Warriors. You look like something else. You look like Ducks.
You're playing hard. I'm proud of you guys.
They're cheap-shotting us to death.
I know they are. I know they are.
It's going to take a miracle for us to hold on.

[enters the lockeroom reading his scholarship]
Dean Portman is awarded a full athletic and academic scholarship to the Eden Hall Academy. I had this lying around the house in Chicago, my attorney thought I should sign, I agreed. It's official boys. I'm back!

[aside to Orien]
Bombay.
Yo, Russ, you gotta teach me how to talk some trash.
It can't be taught, Kenny-man. I mean, it's gotta be the first thing that comes to your mind. You just gotta go for it. Try it.
Hey Ref! You - ...

[covers Ken's mouth]
Ah! Shh. Pick another target.

[stuttering]
Hey, number forty-four, you - you - you - you- you play - you don't play real good.
Yeah, right.
Shorter, man. Get to the point.
Hey, number nine! Bite me!
[is knocked over by number nine player]

[laughs]
Now we're gettin' somewhere.
What'd he say?
Something about a shrinking sphincter.
This ninja stuff really makes you look uh, I don't know how you say um...

[suavely]
Ruggedly handsome?
Amazingly stupid!

[sarcastically]
Very funny.
Waiter I have too many forks... I only need one... Ya'll... It's just...
[Picks up lil' fork]
Hey, what's this lil' bitty one for?

[after Cole steals Charlie's lunch]
Aww. C'mon, my mommy made me brownies
Yeah, fresh warm ones.
It's too bad about your bash brother, I heard he was too scared to leave home.
Portman ain't scared of nothin'.
Eww, what the hell kind of brownies are these?
I gotta tell her to stop using horse turds in the recipe.

[in reference to Bombay]
He IS good.
Just getting started.
Hey Charlie. We've really backed into a corner here. We hold them for 2 minutes, we've got ourselves a tie.
We're up to it.
I know you are. But you deserve to win. Not carless, but not to careful either. You see your shot take it.
[Puts a "C" on Charlie's jersey]
Go get them Captain.
Goldberg! Gold! I knew you could do it!
Don't ever do that to me again!
Goldberg you scored. We win!

You can learn a lot from ants. These Brazilian fire ants can teach you a lot about successful societal structure. You see, there's one queen in there, the rest are dedicated worker ants. Everybody pulls their weight nobody complains same here at Eden Hall, only you are the workers; the backbone.
And you're the queen?
[everyone snickers]
